page.title: 12SAVE OUR SWANS
page.content: Zyllah Cooke is the Windsor-based founder of Save Our Swans, a registered charity set up to look after the hundreds of swans on the Thames being injured and killed by swallowing lead weights left by anglers and recently by seemingly deliberate cruelty.Drink can rings and plastic bags have been found tied on swans . A recent case of shooting by pellets caused massive infection and later death.The centre is run from Zyllah's back garden where in 1984 273 birds were treated by the voluntary helpers backed by the professional skill of Zyllah's vetinary surgeon husband Stephen,a leading authority on mute swans.Her garden is too small and she is seeking new premises.She is hoping that government plans to ban the sale of lead weights will soon become law. by Verity and Clare
